docs.title: Hello World!
docs.text:
The index.md in the /docs folder is the homepage you see here.

The folders in /docs appear as the main sections on the navigation bar.

The notes appear as pages within these sections. For example, [[Note 1]] in Topic 1

docs.title: LaTeX Math Support
docs.text:
LaTeX math is supported using MathJax.

Inline math looks like \(f(x) = x^2\). The input for this is $f(x) = x^2$. Use $...$.

For a block of math, use $$...$$ on separate lines

$$
F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4
$$

gives

\[ F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4 \]

docs.title: Mermaid diagrams
docs.text:
Here's the example from MkDocs Material documentation: 

graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];

docs.title: Text Formatting
docs.text:
You can have lists like this

  • first
  • second
  • third

Or checklist lists to

  • Get
  • things
  • done

Also, get highlights and strikethroughs as above (similar to Obsidian).

More formatting options for your webpage here. (but not compatible with Obsidian)

docs.title: The Capitol
docs.text:
• Reservations Are Recommended
  • Tours begin every 10 minutes until 3:20 p.m.
    • https://tours.visitthecapitol.gov/cvc

docs.title: White House
docs.text: Needed to be submitted 3 months prior to visit

docs.title: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History
Air and Space
docs.text:
• https://airandspace.si.edu/visit/museum-dc
  • Same day passes are given each day

docs.title: Washington Monument
docs.text:
• https://www.nps.gov/wamo/planyourvisit/fees.htm
  • Visitors who are uncomfortable with heights, enclosed spaces, crowding, and elevators should consider that the Washington Monument involves all these experiences.
